{"step_by_step_thinking": "Scar dehiscence refers to the separation or opening of a surgical incision or wound. It commonly occurs in the context of a previous cesarean section scar during pregnancy or labor. Maternal bradycardia, fetal bradycardia, and vaginal bleeding can all be associated with scar dehiscence due to the disruption of blood supply to the uterus. However, hematuria is not typically seen with scar dehiscence as it is unrelated to the uterine incision. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Hematuria.", "answer_choice": "D"}
